body: Please provide a reasonable and isolated Codesandbox example to reproduce the issue. There are way too many side effects and extra components which make it hard for me to investigate the issue.

Thanks, @delijah worth to mention, `isDirty` is doing a deep comparison against your defaultValue. so if you can prove `defaultValues` is set and the field array is not working correctly, then I will investigate for a fix for the bug.

Hey @bluebill1049! I've simplified the examples.

Yes exactly, `defaultValues` is set and field array is not working correctly.

ok, let's focus on this one first: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-km3r6?file=/src/index.js

what are the steps to reproduce the issue? can you also remove all those debug info as well? let's focus on the code and usage. We can console log those values easily.

> ok, let's focus on this one first: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-km3r6?file=/src/index.js
> 
> what are the steps to reproduce the issue? can you also remove all those debug info as well? let's focus on the code and usage. We can console log those values easily.

As described in the issue description...
1. Click on 'Another one' in the Modal/Portal
2. Click on 'Submit' in the Modal/Portal
3. Now you see in the dumped form state, that `isDirty` is still false, but there are `dirtyFields`

I think the debug info is pretty crucial here to highlight the problem.
@bluebill1049 I have simplified the examples again (you'll find the updated codesandbox links in the issue description).
Thanks, @delijah for the update. Much cleaner to focus on the problem now.
That's why i said console.log it's easier hahaha.
just did a quick test, it's working for me, but I am sure I miss the steps. why this input name is not a field array shape?

> That's why i said console.log it's easier hahaha.

yeah it can get tricky ðŸ˜„ but the overview of the data, if it's not blocked by an overlay, is great ðŸ˜‰ 

> why this input name is not a field array shape?

because this is a separate form. it has nothing to do with the field array. this form belongs to the modal. the idea behind it is to have a modal where the user can select additional data from a list, which will get inserted into the field array.

> just did a quick test, it's working for me, but I am sure I miss the steps.

hmm, that's weird. this is how it looks on my site (by the way: exact the same happens in firefox 81.0.1 and safari 14.0):

![Nov-24-2020 00-05-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/237739/100025357-e7d39d80-2de8-11eb-8786-c4178d77b57b.gif)

I have removed all those extra components, have a test below, let me know.

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-useform-template-forked-j2770?file=/src/index.js:182-191
ok, looks like I found the issue, it's due to the `watch` at your debugger.
